Problem:
Consider a system governed by the partial differential equation \\( \\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} + p(x) \\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial x} = 0 \\), where \\( p(x) \\) is a position-dependent velocity field. We analyze the impact of applying a Fourier transform \\( \\mathcal{F} \\) to the function \\( u(x, t) \\) at a specific time.

Given the Fourier transform of \\( u(x, t) \\) at some time \\( t > t_1 \\), can we determine precisely what interventions were used (whether \\( \\mathcal{F} \\), \\( \\mathcal{G} \\), or both), only by knowing the transformed values?
Explanation: The overlapping effects of \\( \\mathcal{F} \\) and \\( \\mathcal{G} \\) on the Fourier transform, as well as the continuous evolution under the PDE, make it difficult to uniquely determine which transformations or interventions were applied at earlier stages.
